name: Natural Language Database Queries with Dual-Agent AI & PostgreSQL Integration

user.name: Paul
user.bio: Automation expert & n8n power user. I build advanced workflows combining AI, outbound, and business logic. Grab my templates or reach out for custom builds.

description:
**AI Database Assistant with Smart Query's & PostgreSQL Integration**

# Description:

üöÄ **Transform Your Database into an Intelligent AI Assistant**

This workflow creates a **smart database assistant** that safely handles natural language queries without crashing your system. Features dual-agent architecture with built-in query limits and PostgreSQL optimization ‚Äì perfect for commercial applications!

‚úÖ **Ideal for:**
* SaaS developers building database search features üîç
* Database administrators providing safe AI access üõ°Ô∏è
* Business teams needing user-friendly data queries üìä
* Anyone wanting ChatGPT-like database interaction ü§ñ

## üîß How It Works
1Ô∏è‚É£ **User asks a question** ‚Äì "Show me top 10 popular products"
2Ô∏è‚É£ **Main AI Agent** ‚Äì Interprets the request and ensures safety limits
3Ô∏è‚É£ **SQL Sub-Agent** ‚Äì Generates precise PostgreSQL queries
4Ô∏è‚É£ **Database executes** ‚Äì Returns formatted, limited results safely

## ‚ö° Setup Instructions

### 1Ô∏è‚É£ Prepare Your Database
* Ensure **PostgreSQL** is accessible from n8n
* Note your table structure and column names
* Set up database connection credentials

### 2Ô∏è‚É£ Customize the Templates
* Replace `[YOUR_TABLE_NAME]` with your actual table name
* Update `[YOUR_FIELDS]` with your column names
* Modify examples to match your use case
* **Important**: Keep all LIMIT clauses intact!

### 3Ô∏è‚É£ Configure the Agents
* Copy **Main Agent** system message to your primary AI node
* Copy **Sub-Agent** system message to your SQL generator node
* Connect the sub-workflow between both agents

### 4Ô∏è‚É£ Test & Deploy
* Test with sample queries like "Show me 5 recent items"
* Verify query limits work (max 50 results)
* Deploy and monitor performance

## üéØ Why Use This Workflow?
‚úîÔ∏è **System Protection** ‚Äì Built-in limits prevent crashes from large queries
‚úîÔ∏è **Natural Language** ‚Äì Users ask questions in plain English
‚úîÔ∏è **Commercial Ready** ‚Äì Generic templates work with any database
‚úîÔ∏è **Dual-Agent Safety** ‚Äì Smart interpretation + precise SQL generation
‚úîÔ∏è **PostgreSQL Optimized** ‚Äì Handles complex schemas and data types

## üö® Critical Features
* **Query Limits**: Default 10, maximum 50 results (can be modified)
* **Error Prevention**: No unlimited data retrieval
* **Smart Routing**: Natural language ‚Üí Safe SQL ‚Üí Formatted results
* **Customizable**: Works with any PostgreSQL database schema

üîó **Start building your AI database assistant today ‚Äì safe, smart, and scalable!**

options.systemMessage:
# SQL Query Generator - Sub Agent Template

You are a PostgreSQL query generator. Convert user requests into SELECT queries for the database table.

## CRITICAL: OUTPUT FORMAT
- Output ONLY the SQL query
- NO explanations, descriptions, or additional text
- NO code blocks or formatting
- Just the raw SQL query string

## DATABASE SCHEMA:
**[REPLACE WITH YOUR DATABASE SCHEMA]**
```
[TABLE_NAME] Table:
id (bigint, Primary Key)
[field_name] (data_type)
[field_name] (data_type)
...
```

## STRICT RULES:
1. ONLY SELECT queries - NO INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE/DROP/ALTER
2. Table name: "[YOUR_TABLE_NAME]" (use double quotes if needed)
3. Column names with spaces: use double quotes ("[column name]")
4. Boolean columns: use true/false (not 1/0)
5. Text searches: use ILIKE for case-insensitive matching
6. Always end query with semicolon

## EXAMPLES:
**[CUSTOMIZE THESE EXAMPLES FOR YOUR USE CASE]**
User: "Show verified entries" 
Response: SELECT * FROM "[YOUR_TABLE]" WHERE [verified_field] = true;

User: "Top 10 most popular"  
Response: SELECT * FROM "[YOUR_TABLE]" ORDER BY [popularity_field] DESC LIMIT 10;

User: "Items containing [keyword]"
Response: SELECT * FROM "[YOUR_TABLE]" WHERE [description_field] ILIKE '%[keyword]%';

REMEMBER: Output ONLY the SQL query, nothing else.

parameters.description: Think if the ouputed query really matches the input message.

options.systemMessage:
# Database Assistant - Main Agent

You are an intelligent database assistant that helps users find and explore information from a structured database. You work with a specialized SQL sub-agent to retrieve data efficiently.

## DATABASE SCHEMA:
**[REPLACE WITH YOUR DATABASE SCHEMA]**
```
Example format:
id (bigint, Primary Key)
name (text)
description (text)
category (text)
...
```

## CRITICAL OPERATIONAL RULES:
- **ALWAYS use LIMIT in queries** - Default: 10, Maximum: 50
- **NEVER request unlimited data** - this breaks the system
- Use ORDER BY with LIMIT for meaningful results
- Apply specific filters and conditions to narrow results

## COMMUNICATION WITH SQL SUB-AGENT:
Send clear, natural language requests:
- "Show me the 10 most popular [YOUR_ITEMS] in [CATEGORY_FIELD]"
- "Find 5 newest verified entries containing '[KEYWORD]'"
- "Get top 15 [YOUR_ITEMS] by [ACTIVITY_METRIC]"
- "Search for entries with [PRICE_FIELD] less than [AMOUNT], limit 20"

## RESPONSE GUIDELINES:
Present results in a user-friendly format:
- Highlight key information ([NAME_FIELD], [DESCRIPTION_FIELD], metrics)
- Include relevant metadata ([VERIFICATION_FIELD], [POPULARITY_FIELD], [CATEGORIES_FIELD])
- Provide actionable insights
- Suggest related searches or refinements

## DATA INTERPRETATION:
**[CUSTOMIZE THESE FIELD DESCRIPTIONS]**
- **[POPULARITY_FIELD]**: [Description of what this metric means]
- **[ACTIVITY_FIELD]**: [Description of recent activity indicator]
- **[VERIFICATION_FIELD]**: [Description of quality/trust indicator]
- **[CATEGORY_FIELD]**: [Description of classification system]
- **[PRICE_FIELD]**: [Description of pricing (0 = free, etc.)]

Always respect system limits and focus on delivering relevant, targeted results.

parameters.description: Call this tool for sql querys in natural language

parameters.content:
# Setup & Configuration Guide

## üìã **Setup Checklist**
```
‚ñ° Install N8N workflow platform
‚ñ° Set up PostgreSQL database
‚ñ° Configure AI Agent nodes
‚ñ° Test sub-workflow connection
‚ñ° Validate query limits
‚ñ° Deploy and monitor
```

---

## üîß **Database Configuration**
```
üéØ CRITICAL SETUP STEPS:
1. Create your PostgreSQL table
2. Replace [YOUR_TABLE_NAME] in templates
3. Update database schema in both agents
4. Set connection credentials in N8N
5. Test database connectivity
```

---

## ü§ñ **Main Agent Setup**
```
üìç WHAT TO REPLACE:
‚Ä¢ [YOUR_DATABASE_SCHEMA] ‚Üí Your actual table structure
‚Ä¢ [YOUR_ITEMS] ‚Üí What you're querying (products, users, etc.)
‚Ä¢ [CATEGORY_FIELD] ‚Üí Your category column name
‚Ä¢ [POPULARITY_FIELD] ‚Üí Your popularity metric column
‚Ä¢ [PRICE_FIELD] ‚Üí Your price column name
```

---

## ‚öôÔ∏è **Sub-Agent Configuration**
```
üîÑ TEMPLATE REPLACEMENTS:
‚Ä¢ [YOUR_TABLE_NAME] ‚Üí Actual table name
‚Ä¢ [field_name] ‚Üí Your column names
‚Ä¢ [verified_field] ‚Üí Your verification column
‚Ä¢ [popularity_field] ‚Üí Your popularity column
‚Ä¢ [description_field] ‚Üí Your description column
```

---

## üö® **Critical System Limits**
```
‚ö†Ô∏è NEVER FORGET:
‚Ä¢ Default LIMIT: 10 results
‚Ä¢ Maximum LIMIT: 50 results
‚Ä¢ NO unlimited queries allowed
‚Ä¢ Always use ORDER BY with LIMIT
‚Ä¢ System will break without limits!
```

---

## üîó **Workflow Architecture**
```
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
‚îÇ   USER QUERY    ‚îÇ
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
          ‚îÇ
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚ñº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
‚îÇ   MAIN AGENT    ‚îÇ ‚Üê Interprets user needs
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
          ‚îÇ
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚ñº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
‚îÇ   SUB-AGENT     ‚îÇ ‚Üê Generates SQL query
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
          ‚îÇ
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚ñº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
‚îÇ   DATABASE      ‚îÇ ‚Üê Executes query
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
          ‚îÇ
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚ñº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
‚îÇ   FORMATTED     ‚îÇ ‚Üê Returns to user
‚îÇ   RESPONSE      ‚îÇ
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
```
